text: Sertraline (trade names Zoloft, Lustral) is an antidepressant.Leonard J. Haas, Handbook of Primary Care Psychology (Oxford; New York: Oxford University Press, 2004), p. 287 It was introduced by Pfizer in 1991. Sertraline is mainly prescribed for major depressive disorder in adult outpatients. It is also prescribed for obsessiveâ€“compulsive, panic, and social anxiety disorders in both adults and children. In 2011, it was the third-most prescribed antidepressant on the U.S. retail market, with 37 million prescriptions. == References == Category:Drugs used in psychiatry Category:Organonitrogen compounds Category:Organochlorides
title: Sertraline
